intro: Microstylis wallichii var. biloba, commonly known as the broad-leafed microstylis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural range.
